topic.title: Freemium plugins
topic.p: Freemium plugins offer some features at no cost in addition to paid features. The reasons for implementing this model can be different, from helping you attract new users, or simply making some profit without going fully paid.

note.p: If you're switching the payment model from free to freemium, please inform your users in advance.

chapter.title: How does it look for users?

topic.p: Users will see an explanatory note under the Get button that informs them about paid features.

img.alt: An example of how the tag looks like

topic.p: Starting from 213.* version of IDE, such plugins are marked with the Freemium tag and the “Install a version with limited functionality for free or activate the 30-day trial for full access” note:

tip.p: In the older IDE versions freemium plugins have the Freemium tag along with the Paid tag.

chapter.title: How to make your plugin freemium?
